ddos.ddos_protection.advanced_dns_protec: Detects and mitigates sophisticated and randomized DNS-based DDoS attacks such as Random Prefix Attacks.

Sensitivity levels are based on the thresholds and determine when to initiate mitigation. A higher sensitivity level means that the mitigation system will begin mitigating faster. A lower sensitivity provides more tolerance for potentially suspicious DNS queries.

Sensitivity levels are based on the thresholds and determine when to initiate mitigation. A higher sensitivity level means that the mitigation system will begin mitigating faster. A lower sensitivity provides more tolerance for potentially suspicious TCP packets.
The sensitivity to DNS queries that have not been recently seen.
Apply Advanced DNS Protection rule to all incoming packets
Apply Advanced DNS Protection rule to a subset of incoming packets
Switch to monitor mode before increasing the sensitivity to avoid false positives.
The results will appear here once you add at least one rule.
ddos.ddos_protection.advanced_tcp_protec: The results will appear here once you add at least one rule.
ddos.ddos_protection.general_settings.de: General settings that enable and control the use of the Advanced TCP Protection and the Advanced DNS Protection systems.
ddos.ddos_protection.page.description: Cloudflare's Advanced DDoS Protection systems leverage stateful inspection and traffic profiling to protect your Internet properties against sophisticated DDoS attacks.
ddos.ddos_protection.page.title: Advanced L3/4 DDoS Protection
ddos.ddos_protection.settings.getting_st: Add prefixes to instruct the system on which traffic to route through the system.
Follow these steps to get started with Advanced TCP Protection and Advanced DNS Protection.
Enable the Advanced DDoS system and begin routing traffic through it.
Create rules for the TCP and DNS Protection systems to enable mitigation. Start with Monitoring mode.
Thresholds are based on your network's unique traffic, they define the sensitivity levels, and are configured by Cloudflare.
ddos.ddos_protection.settings.prefixes.a: Select which of your prefixes are going to be affected by Advanced DDoS Protection rules. You can also select a subset of the prefixes added to be excluded from the rule.
Unapproved prefixes are hidden as they cannot be added to Advanced DDoS Protection.
Add all (%{smart_count} prefix) |||| Add all (%{smart_count} prefixes)
ddos.ddos_protection.settings.prefixes.d: Are you sure you want to remove %{smart_count} prefix? |||| Are you sure you want to remove %{smart_count} prefixes?
The results will appear here once you add at least one prefix.
Turn on this toggle to exclude a prefix or prefix subset from Advanced L3/4 DDoS Protection.
ddos.ddos_protection.settings.prefixes.m: Prefixes that you want to protect from sophisticated DDoS attacks can be an IP address or an IP range in CIDR format and must be a prefix onboarded to Magic Transit or a subset of a prefix onboarded to Magic Transit.
ddos.ddos_protection.settings.prefixes.w: Make sure your current Advanced DDoS Protection configuration takes into account the traffic levels on the prefixes you are adding. If you are applying mitigation actions to incoming traffic, consider switching your rules to Monitoring mode before proceeding.
